intro: Espeletia brassicoidea subsp. brassicoidea, commonly known as the "Cerro de la Muerte" or "Death Mountain" plant, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense, rosette-like growth habit and is native to the high-altitude grasslands of the Andes in Colombia. The plant features thick, woolly leaves that help it conserve water in its arid, high-altitude environment. It produces showy, yellow flower heads that bloom in the summer months. This species is adapted to extreme conditions, including strong winds and intense sunlight.
